ud7.2:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.2:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Sāriputta was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring Venerable Bhaddiya the Dwarf with even more Dhamma talk, thinking that he was still a trainee.
ud7.2:2.1_0: The Buddha saw what was happening.
ud7.2:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud7.2:4.1_0: “They’ve cut the cycle, gone to the wishless;
ud7.2:4.2_0: the streams are dried, they flow no more.
ud7.2:4.3_0: Cut, the cycle no longer turns.
